title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. Israel's prime minister Naftali Bennett said he would move to dissolve Parliament and hold a new election. Who will lead during the interim?

A. Yair Lapid

B. Benjamin Netanyahu

C. Idit Silman

D. Golda Meir

---

2. What's going to divide itself in three?

A. France

B. Kellogg

C. Mondelez

D. PepsiCo

---

3. An earthquake killed more than 1,000 people in Afghanistan. Which province was hit hardest?

A. Kunduz

B. Faryab

C. Paktika

D. Herat

---

4. The Biden administration plans a new regulatory approach to cigarettes. What is it?

A. To ban them

B. To subsidize vaping

C. To make them nearly nicotine-free

D. To enrich them with niacin

---

5. A new study says Medicare could have saved up to $3.6 billion in one year by buying drugs from whose pharmacy?

A. Hunter Thompson

B. Mark Cuban

C. Elon Musk

D. Walmart

---

6. Majolica was in the news. Why?

A. The Spanish white wine is having a summer moment.

B. The arty island retreat is sinking fast.

C. The Brazilian singer has a new hit album.

D. A new exhibit focuses on the colorful Victorian ceramics.

---

7. The richest resident of Illinois said he's moved to Florida and is taking his business along. Who is it?

A. Ken Griffin

B. Joe Mansueto

C. Sam Zell

D. Mark Walter

---

8. Gustavo Petro was chosen as president -- of what?

A. Colombia

B. Columbia University

C. Columbia Pictures

D. The 2026 Columbian Exposition

---

9. For the first time, a bloodhound is champion of the Westminster dog show. Name that canine.

A. Trombone

B. Trumpet

C. Tuba

D. Flugel

---

ANSWERS

1. A

2. B

3. C

4. C

5. B

6. D

7. A

8. A

9. B
